notes.References: Gram-positive bacteria use the ABC transporter of operon ykoCDEF for the transport of thiamin and hydroxymethylpyrimidine. While ykoCDE were found in the S. aureus genome, we couldnot find ykoF

notes.Notes: The pathway is essential for the survival of S. aureus in lactose-rich media such as milk, because if it does not function properly, D-galactose accumulates and bacterial growth is inhibited. http://www.jbc.org/content/282/27/19948.full.pdf

Thiamin transport via ABC system
reactions.gene_reaction_rule: (USA300HOU_RS05355 or USA300HOU_RS14565) and (USA300HOU_RS14570 or USA300HOU_RS05360) and USA300HOU_RS05365

notes.References: Gram-positive bacteria use the ABC transporter of operon ykoCDEF for the transport of thiamin and hydroxymethylpyrimidine. This ABC transporter contains two transmembrane components YkoC and YkoE, an ATPase component YkoD, and a thiamin/HMP-binding protein YkoF. While ykoCDE were found in the S. aureus genome, we couldnot find ykoF
